events.name: Kx Community March Meetup
events.description: Hi everyone! Our Kx Community Meetup event will be held Wednesday, March 16th - hope all of you can join us! Details - 7:00-7:15 - Colin Dooley - Using kdb+ for MiFiD / MAR 7:15-7:30 - Fionn Gaston - kdb+ statistics and evolution 7:30-7:45 - Robert Lee - HTML5 Dashboards Complimentary drinks and food will be served Please email Feargal Murphy by Monday, March 14 to confirm your attendance-  [masked] The Kx Team

events.name: Product Design Meet-up #1
events.description: The first product design meet-up will be held on 16th March, 2016 at the National Design Centre auditorium as part of Design Singapore Week 2016. The digital product design scene in Singapore is growing. There are more and more talented in-house designers, who lead and innovate through UI and UX design. For the first meet-up, speakers from product companies will share their design stories, how they solve problems, and their approach to design thinking. Speakers (TBC)... If you're interested, please RSVP. The National Design Centre auditorium can only accommodate 122 seats. First come, first served.
events.location: National Design Centre Auditorium 111 Middle Rd, 188969, Singapore

events.name: JHipster 3.0 night!
events.description: Note: we have interviewed Deepu here. JHipster is one of the fastest growing projects on the Spring/AngularJS sphere. And it's now getting support for microservices (starting from JHipster 3.0). Deepu K Sasidharan is based in Singapore and is one of the core JHipster committers. He has successfully used JHipster on large projects in Singapore. Via lots of demos, Deepu will take us through the core features of JHipster and the latest changes such as: • move to microservices • Entity update and how to use JHipster when you have a large number of entities As usual, we will meet at 7PM for pizzas and will start our first talk at 7.30PM. We look forward to seeing you there!
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Nosql databases
events.description: Hi all, Gaurav and I would like to have a sharing session on nosql databases and R. Gaurav already has a lot of experience working with such platforms, and has some solutions to share. We hope to have a session where we can demonstrate some of the strengths/weaknesses of using such databases with R. If anyone out there already uses R with nosql databases, do drop me a mail at viknesh.gopal@gmail.com. We can discuss more about what we can share and show. Cheers,Vik
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Monthly Meetup  -- Security for a connected world
events.description: Null meets are free for anyone to attend. There are absolutely no fees. Just come with an open mind and willingness to share and learn Agenda :  Introduction & Networking  security for a connected world  by Chadi Hantouche, Solucom Abstract: Connected devices are invading our everyday life, and this trend is going to grow over the coming years. On a corporate level, the Internet of Things is also increasingly praised by employees, and integrated into business processes. Through business projects, we were able to identify the 4 security dimensions of the IoT. We developed a risk assessment methodology that is specific to this domain, named “CARA”: Conceive, Acquire, Recommend, Accommodate. This presentation will allow us to put forward an overview of these risks (with examples of real-life attacks), and offer a dedicated risk assessment approach that can be applied in business settings. Bio: Chadi is a risk management & cybersecurity senior manager at Solucom, a global advisory company now opening an office in Singapore. For over 10 years, he has helped companies assessing their risk and maturity level, and define associated solutions. He has a focus on security to support innovative technologies (Big Data, Internet of Things, Cloud computing, Mobility) as well as prevention and reaction against cyberattacks. Chadi is a CISSP, ISO 27001 LI and ITIL certified professional. He is a regular speaker on French and international TV channels and newspapers, security associations chapters and summits, and lecturer in several computer science universities.
events.location: Thought Works,  Level 3, 87B Amoy Street, 069906, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: Lesser-known China, and solving healthcare problems with open technology. HackerspaceSG Awesome Talks, March 2016
events.description:
This month we explore life away from affluent, comfortable cities.

--

Finding India In China
Anurag Viswanath

Anurag has just published a book called Finding India in China. It is an extensive account of China as a nation with many cultures and sub cultures, quite like India. The comparison is striking and makes the reader notice likeness and un-likeness both, as easily as one would expect a walkthrough, that an experiential book should make possible.

--

The value of open source healthcare IT solutions
Mayank Sharma

The talk will be focused on the value of open source healthcare IT solutions and specifically how OpenMRS tries to solve healthcare sector related problems using open source technologies. Mayank will also talk about how people can get involved and begin contributing to the project.

OpenMRS Inc is the largest java based open source medical record system that is widely used in Kenya, Rwanda, Haiti, Mozambique, India and at many more locations under resource constrained settings.
